sections.heading:
Temporal Reasoning in AI Systems
Abhishek Sharma
sections.content:
3840 Far West Blvd, Austin, TX 78731
abhishek81@gmail.com
Abstract reasoning. In particular, the problem of temporal projection
Commonsense temporal reasoning at scale is a core problem (i.e., the persistence of facts) has not received sufficient
for cognitive systems. The correct inference of the duration attention in the knowledge-based systems community. For
for which fluents hold is required by many tasks, including this reason, many cognitive systems have limited deductive
natural language understanding and planning. Many AI
closure because existing facts (true at a given time point)

representation and reasoning schemes required for robust reasoning schemes are needed to solve these problems?
